medical_history.chief_complaint: High-grade dysplasia associated with fundic gland polyposis in a patient with familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with FAP at age 28 and underwent colectomy. He was followed up with gastrointestinal endoscopy since age 37. At age 46, a biopsy from the gastric body revealed high-grade dysplasia, corresponding to Category 4 in the Vienna classification. Symptoms progressed from fundic gland polyposis without dysplasia/carcinoma to high-grade dysplasia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP) and underwent colectomy at age 28. No other relevant medical history is specified.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's niece has FAP; his mother and brother died of colon cancer at ages 39 and 41, respectively.
